title: Correspondence Of Robert Dudley, Earl Of Leycester, During His Government Of The Low Countries In The Years 1585-86
description: The book ""Correspondence Of Robert Dudley, Earl Of Leycester, During His Government Of The Low Countries In The Years 1585-86"" is a collection of letters written by Robert Dudley, the Earl of Leycester, during his time as governor of the Low Countries in the years 1585-86. The book includes various letters written by Dudley to different individuals, including Queen Elizabeth I of England, discussing his experiences and challenges as governor, as well as his opinions on the political and military situation in the Low Countries. The letters provide insights into the political and military strategies employed by Dudley during his tenure and offer a glimpse into the complex relationships between England, the Low Countries, and other European powers during the late 16th century. The book is a valuable resource for historians and scholars interested in this period of European history and the role of England in it.This scarce antiquarian book is a facsimile reprint of the old original and may contain some imperfections such as library marks and notations. Because we believe this work is culturally important, we have made it available as part of our commitment for protecting, preserving, and promoting the world's literature in affordable, high quality, modern editions, that are true to their original work.
author: Robert  Dudley
